intro: Pedicularis gruina subsp. polyphylla, commonly known as the green monkey orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and meadows. It has a short, hairy stem and produces small, lance-shaped leaves. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
